greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts <= phi(n), where phi is Euler's totient function (cf. A000010).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i=1, 1,
mathematica: (* Requires version 6.0+ *) Table[Length[IntegerPartitions[n, n, Range[EulerPhi[n]]]], {n, 0, 47}] (* _Ivan Neretin_, May 11 2015 *)

intPartLen[n_, i_] := intPartLen[n, i] = If[n == 0 || i == 1, 1, intPartLen[n, i - 1] + If[i > n, 0, intPartLen[n - i, i]]]; intPartLenPhi[n_] := intPartLen[n, EulerPhi[n]]; Table[intPartLenPhi[n], {n, 0, 99}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 11 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: p ks'@(k:ks) m = if m < k then 0 else p ks' (m - k) + p ks m
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 05 2013
